impact_weight: The reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can lead to improved air quality by decreasing the amount of pollutants released into the atmosphere, thus reinforcing the achievement of air quality targets.
Reducing GHG emissions can also contribute to improved water quality by decreasing the amount of pollutants that enter water bodies, thus aiding in the achievement of water quality targets.
Promoting competitive agriculture can enable the production of high-quality food at lower costs, creating conditions that further the goal of ensuring food affordability.
Reducing the use of pesticides can help maintain soil health by decreasing the amount of harmful chemicals that enter the soil, thus reinforcing the achievement of soil health targets.

Promoting healthy food options can lead to reduced air pollution by encouraging the consumption of locally sourced and sustainable food, creating conditions that further the goal of improving air quality.

Ensuring food affordability can also contribute to improved sanitation by enabling individuals to purchase and consume nutritious food, reducing the risk of food-borne illnesses and creating conditions that further the goal of ensuring social security and sanitation.
